comments.body: Thanks once again for your contribution @barinbritva! This part is correct as Region can be any string. We would appreciate if you could resend the PR excluding the changes you made to Region not being optional in makeBucket.
I believe in this case I'll receive messages from definitely typed bot asking me to review other PRs, and I don't feel like I'm entitled to do that
Are you familiar with what cases `extensions` are available? I've tried reading the documentation but couldn't find any notes on their "extension" system.

I found something. It's [in the doc](https://docs.min.io/docs/javascript-client-api-reference#listObjectsV2WithMetadata) below `listObjectsV2WithMetadata` method:

```
var stream = minioClient.extensions.listObjectsV2WithMetadata('mybucket','', true,'')
stream.on('data', function(obj) { console.log(obj) } )
stream.on('error', function(err) { console.log(err) } )
```

It seems it's some part of server configuration - https://docs.min.io/docs/minio-bucket-replication-guide.html
In heading MinIO Extension
ðŸ¤”

> Are you familiar with what cases `extensions` are available? I've tried reading the documentation but couldn't find any notes on their "extension" system.

From the client's perspective, this property (the *extensions*) is available as a lazy getter (as seen [here](https://github.com/minio/minio-js/blob/master/src/main/minio.js#L3047)). Actual extensions are defined in a separate file - [here](https://github.com/minio/minio-js/blob/master/src/main/extensions.js). No server checks are performed on the backend side to see if they are indeed supported. Under the hood, this method is using the S3 *listObjectsV2* API with an additional query parameter `metadata=true`.

As for the server configuration goes - I'm not aware if there are any specific ones, that must be set before using this functionality. Using a pre-built Docker image, this works just fine out of the box.
